Changes.Target: Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/abidingangelfish, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/aizenmedaka, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/berylconch, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/bitterpufferfish, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/brownpufferfish, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/brownshirakodai, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/truefruitangler, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/glazemedaka, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/goldenkoi, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/halcyonjadeaxemarlin, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/lazuriteaxemarlin, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/lumitoile, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/medaka, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/peachangler, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/purpleshirakodai, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/rustykoi, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/sandstormangler, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/sangopearl, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/starconch, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/sunsetcloudangler, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/sweetflowermedaka, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/teacoloredshirakodai, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/tidalga, Mods/otohime.teyvatfish/truefruitangler

{{ModId}}_Abiding_Angelfish.Name: Abiding Angelfish
{{ModId}}_Abiding_Angelfish.Description: A rare and valuable butterflyfish variant from Liyue.

{{ModId}}_Aizen_Medaka.Name: Aizen Medaka
{{ModId}}_Aizen_Medaka.Description: Long ago, there was a funny story that said that you could get Aizen Medaka by throwing normal Medaka into a pot of blue dye.

{{ModId}}_Beryl_Conch.Name: Beryl Conch
{{ModId}}_Beryl_Conch.Description: Despite the name, it is not a shell but something condensed from pure elemental energy.

{{ModId}}_Bitter_Pufferfish.Name: Bitter Pufferfish
{{ModId}}_Bitter_Pufferfish.Description: As the name suggests, this creature spreads bitterness wherever it goes in the underwater world.

{{ModId}}_Brown_Pufferfish.Name: Brown Pufferfish
{{ModId}}_Brown_Pufferfish.Description: This fish is capable of sucking water into its body before expelling it like a cannon from its mouth with a strong force and pinpoint accuracy.

{{ModId}}_Brown_Shirakodai.Name: Brown Shirakodai
{{ModId}}_Brown_Shirakodai.Description: Earthen-colored patterns run across its body, and its temper is also as steady as stone.

{{ModId}}_Glaze_Medaka.Name: Glaze Medaka
{{ModId}}_Glaze_Medaka.Description: This species has inscrutable behavioral patterns, and they can often be seen bursting into struggling fits out of the blue.

{{ModId}}_Golden_Koi.Name: Golden Koi
{{ModId}}_Golden_Koi.Description: A large fish said to be the descendant of dragons.

{{ModId}}_Halcyon_Jade_Axe_Marlin.Name: Halcyon Jade Axe Marlin
{{ModId}}_Halcyon_Jade_Axe_Marlin.Description: The jade-colored Axe Marlin prefers to live in areas where aquatic plants flourish, and where its shape easily blends in with the background.

{{ModId}}_Lazurite_Axe_Marlin.Name: Lazurite Axe Marlin
{{ModId}}_Lazurite_Axe_Marlin.Description: A fish with unique morphology and Sumeru's cousin to the butterfly fish.

{{ModId}}_Lumitoile.Name: Lumitoile
{{ModId}}_Lumitoile.Description: A soft-bodied animal that emits a gentle light.

{{ModId}}_Medaka.Name: Medaka
{{ModId}}_Medaka.Description: A lively, energetic fish famous for its petal-shaped tail.

{{ModId}}_Peach_Angler.Name: Peach Angler
{{ModId}}_Peach_Angler.Description: These fish are, as their name suggests, so sweet that they are considered 'ideal for dessert.'

{{ModId}}_Purple_Shirakodai.Name: Purple Shirakodai
{{ModId}}_Purple_Shirakodai.Description: Lovely purple patterns run across its body, and they love to swim together in schools to fend off natural dangers and predators.

{{ModId}}_Rusty_Koi.Name: Rusty Koi
{{ModId}}_Rusty_Koi.Description: This is a variant species of Koi, and is sometimes termed the 'awakened dragon' amongst them.

{{ModId}}_Sandstorm_Angler.Name: Sandstorm Angler
{{ModId}}_Sandstorm_Angler.Description: With its immense strength and strongest horns amongst its kind, this fish acts as an 'underwater workhorse.'

{{ModId}}_Sango_Pearl.Name: Sango Pearl
{{ModId}}_Sango_Pearl.Description: A precious pearl that grows in the coral of Watatsumi. Gives off a cool sheen like that of the moonlight.

{{ModId}}_Starconch.Name: Starconch
{{ModId}}_Starconch.Description: Hold it close to your ear, and hear the longing calls of the sea.

{{ModId}}_Sunset_Cloud_Angler.Name: Sunset Cloud Angler
{{ModId}}_Sunset_Cloud_Angler.Description: When cooked in a special way, the acidity actually adds to the freshness of the fish. As a result, this fish sells very well.

{{ModId}}_Sweet_Flower_Medaka.Name: Sweet-Flower Medaka
{{ModId}}_Sweet_Flower_Medaka.Description: It might be because this fish has a sweet tooth, but every bone in its body seems to serve as an antenna to seek out sweet treats.

{{ModId}}_Tea_Colored_Shirakodai.Name: Tea-Colored Shirakodai
{{ModId}}_Tea_Colored_Shirakodai.Description: This fish has a lovely, streamlined dorsal fin, and has the nickname 'Queen of the Waters.'

{{ModId}}_Tidalga.Name: Tidalga
{{ModId}}_Tidalga.Description: An algae floating with the tides that sustains itself by feeding on substances produced by other plants.

{{ModId}}_True_Fruit_Angler.Name: True Fruit Angler
{{ModId}}_True_Fruit_Angler.Description: This fish looks like an unripe fruit on a tree branch, hence the nickname 'True Fruit.'
